intro: Pseudognaphalium antennarioides, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flower heads that are clustered in dense, spherical clusters. It is native to parts of Africa and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Pseudognaphalium antennarioides is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
